page.title: 02FARMING
page.content: Cozens farm is situated to the east of High Ongar village on the north of the main Epping to Chelmsford road. When the present owners took over the farm forty years ago,it was a mixed arable,pasture and animal farm. The work was done by four men,two horses,a cart,one tractor,plough and cutter.The 183 acre farm noe has dairy and beef cattle and the fields are used for pasture and hay crops.It is highly mechanised and worked by the owners and one other man.The milk is sold to a dairy at Chadwell Heath in litres and the farm has a strict quota that they may produce.Over that amount,they are fined 17\p per litre. The young cattle are sold if not being kept for the dairy herd.The milking parlour is of a heringbone design and the milk is collected by a tanker each morning.
